discussion.content: Correct. Tested in system

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

You manage Dynamics 365 Customer Service. You have a routing rule set named CustomerResolution that assigns general inquiry cases to a queue named GeneralInquiry.

You need to assign technical support cases to a queue named TechSupport.

Which four actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.

//IMG//

comments.content: Agreed. Assigning a case doesn't cause case creation...

discussion.content: I suppose last 2 answers are wrong.

comments.content:
I believe the question is really bad. The thing that will happen is:
When Two agents create a case - you will get two cases.
When A workflow assigns a case to two agents - you will get one case but two queue items.
When custom api assings to two agents - you will get one case but two queue items. 
So I think the given answer is wrong, because we are talking about the number of cases created. And not about the 'duplicates that the manager thinks he sees in the queues'

discussion.content: Seems correct: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-service/set-up-queues-manage-activities-cases?tabs=customerserviceadmincenter#assign-items-to-agents

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

A service manager discovers a high number of cases in the agent queues. Cases are created manually but can be reassigned using a workflow or custom API.

The manager needs to know whether cases are getting duplicated because of simultaneous case creation or simultaneous case assignment.

You need to identify the number of cases that are created in each scenario.

How many cases are created? To answer, drag the appropriate cases created options to the correct simultaneous actions. Each cases created option may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

DRAG DROP
-

You are a Dynamics 365 Customer Service administrator.

You create a new entity named Root Cause Escalation. Queues must be used for new Root Cause Escalation records. The records must be automatically assigned to the record owner’s default queue when a record is created.

You need to implement the proper functionality to meet the requirements.

Which three actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.

//IMG//

discussion.content: Correct

questions.question_text:
You are a Dynamics 365 Customer Service system administrator. You work with the Customer Service Hub application.

You need to enable entities for service-level agreements (SLAs).

For which entity can you enable SLAs?

discussion.content:
Correct. 

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-service/enable-entities-service-level-agreements

questions.question_text:
You are a Dynamics 365 for Customer Service administrator.
Your company provides standard support contracts for a total of 20 hours of email support. All 20 hours are for email support only. Phone support is offered as a premium service in allotments of 10 incidents.
You need to set up an entitlement template for the standard support.
What should you configure?

discussion.content:
Dear Bro's:

The question here is: "You need to set up an entitlement template for the STANDARD support.''

Answer is B. Read carefully ;)
Correct Answer is B.

Selected Answer: B
Answer is B. "You need to set up an entitlement template for the STANDARD support.''

Selected Answer: B
It's B.

The correct option to set up an entitlement template for the standard email support would be:

Option C:

Set the value of the Total terms field for an entitlement to 20.
Set the entitlement channel option to Email.
Set the value of the Total terms field to 10 for the Phone option.
This option correctly sets up the entitlement template for the standard email support and premium phone support in allotments of 10 incidents. The "Total terms" field is set to 20 to cover the standard email support. Then, the "entitlement channel" option is set to Email and the "Total Terms" field is set to 10 for the Phone option to provide premium phone support. By setting up the entitlement in this way, the template tracks the usage of both types of support to ensure that customers do not overuse their allocated support resources.

Selected Answer: B
Answer is B

Selected Answer: B
It says "Standard support"

Selected Answer: B
B is answer
wait I can see where you guys are coming from. This should be B
answer is D guys
The correct answer is B, because you have to set standard support, not both of them.

comments.content: The first is a standard support so the correct answer is B

discussion.content:
I think there is 2 records :

- the first should managed "hours". You have to set "Allocation Type" to "number of hours" and set "Total Term" to 20 then add "Email" from "Entitlement Channel" with 20 in "Total Unit" value

- the second should managed "incidents". You have to set "Allocation Type" to ""number of cases" and set "Total Term" to 10 then Add "Phone" from "Entitlement Channel" with 0 in "Total Unit" value

A. Set up an entitlement record for each account. Set the value of the Total terms field for an entitlement to 20. Do not configure an entitlement channel. If you don’t configure the channel, cases from any channel will be applied with the entitlement.
B. Set the value of the Total terms field for an entitlement to 20. Set the value of the entitlement channel option to Email. You are setting up entitlement template for standard support only, not premium one, so you don’t have to worry about Phone Channel.
C. Set up an entitlement record for each account. Set the value of the Total terms field for an entitlement to 20. Set the entitlement channel option to Web. Set the value of the Total terms field to 20. Set the channel option to Web? Web and Email are different.
D. Set the value of the Total terms field for an entitlement to 20. Set the entitlement channel option to Email. Set the value of the Total terms field to 0. Add the Phone option. Set the value of the Total Terms field to 10. You cannot mix two allocation types in one entitlement.
I go for B
I disagree. I think the correct answer is B because the question is specific to standard support.

Ah....disregard. I misread the answer. I think it should be read as:
(FIRST) Set the value of the Total terms field for an entitlement to 20. Set the entitlement channel option to Email. 
(THEN)Set the value of the Total terms field for an entitlement to 0. Set the entitlement channel option to Phone. 
(Then - continuing)Set the value of the Total terms field for an entitlement to 10....(left blank)

comments.content: tested you are right B is most valid option

discussion.content:
"Your company provides standard support contracts for a total of 20 hours of email support. All 20 hours are for email support only. Phone support is offered as a premium service in allotments of 10 incidents.
You need to set up an entitlement template for the standard support."

...the question specifies STANDARD support only. So why are we setting up Premium support in the answer? Doesn't make sense. I think either part of the question is missing or the answer is incorrect and should be (B).

choices.B: Set the value of the Total terms field for an entitlement to 20. Set the value of the entitlement channel option to Email.
choices.D: Set the value of the Total terms field for an entitlement to 20. Set the entitlement channel option to Email. Set the value of the Total terms field to 0. Add the Phone option. Set the value of the Total Terms field to 10.
choices.C: Set up an entitlement record for each account. Set the value of the Total terms field for an entitlement to 20. Set the entitlement channel option to Web. Set the value of the Total terms field to 20.
choices.A: Set up an entitlement record for each account. Set the value of the Total terms field for an entitlement to 20. Do not configure an entitlement channel.
